[matChipListLabel] mat-chip-listbox missing accessible label. Screen readers cannot identify the chip list purpose How to fix: - Add aria-label to mat-chip-listbox - Add aria-labelledby referencing visible label WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/chips/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-chip-set> (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.html:1) [colorContrast] Low contrast 2.17:1 (needs 4.5:1). Low contrast text is difficult to read for users with low vision How to fix: - Increase contrast by darkening text or lightening background - Use contrast checker tool to verify WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) | See: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/ Found: "button": #ffffff on rgba(239, 151, 169, 0.05) (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1) [colorContrast] Low contrast 1.91:1 (needs 4.5:1). Low contrast text is difficult to read for users with low vision How to fix: - Increase contrast by darkening text or lightening background - Use contrast checker tool to verify WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) | See: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/ Found: ".lightbox-tags": #e8899b on #ffd9df (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1) [contentOverflow] Potential content overflow detected in "============================================================================
.masonry-container". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1) [focusWithinSupport] Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.item-icon-container, .item-icon, .item-tags) (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1) [pointerEventsNone] pointer-events: none may hide interactive element. Users cannot interact with elements that have pointer-events disabled How to fix: - Ensure element is not intended to be interactive - Use disabled attribute instead for form elements WCAG 2.1.1: Keyboard Found: a subtle accent background tint &::after (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses animations and transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: redu... (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1) [smallFontSize] Font size 10px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision How to fix: - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability - Test at 200% zoom WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text Found: ".tag" (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub
oro-wedding\src\app\media\category-interactive-components\inspiration\masonry-board.scss:1)

.reply-card". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow [hoverWithoutFocus] :hover styles without matching :focus styles. Keyboard users miss visual feedback available to mouse users How to fix: - Add matching :focus styles - Use :hover, :focus { } combined selector - Consider :focus-visible for keyboard-only focus WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: .dietary-button:hover [hoverWithoutFocus] :hover styles without matching :focus styles. Keyboard users miss visual feedback available to mouse users How to fix: - Add matching :focus styles - Use :hover, :focus { } combined selector - Consider :focus-visible for keyboard-only focus WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: .promo-cta:hover

testcase.name: ChecklistAddDialog
testcase.failure: [clickWithoutKeyboard] Click handler without keyboard support. Keyboard users cannot activate this element How to fix: - Add (keydown.enter) or (keydown.space) handler - Use <button> instead of <div> or <span> - Add tabindex="0" and keyboard event handlers WCAG 2.1.1: Keyboard Found: <div> (line 12) (ChecklistAddDialog (inline template):1) [clickWithoutRole] Clickable element missing role. Screen readers cannot identify the element as interactive How to fix: - Use semantic element: <button>, <a>, <input> - Add role="button" with tabindex="0" - Add appropriate ARIA role WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value Found: <div> (line 12) (ChecklistAddDialog (inline template):1) [colorContrast] Contrast 3.12:1 only meets AA for large text (18pt+). Normal-sized text requires higher contrast ratio How to fix: - Increase contrast to 4.5:1 for normal text - Acceptable for text 18pt+ or 14pt bold WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) Found: ".task-chip.selected": white on #2196f3 (ChecklistAddDialog (inline styles):1) [focusWithinSupport] Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.selected) (ChecklistAddDialog (inline styles):1) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: reduce (ChecklistAddDialog (inline styles):1)

How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.selected, .form-group) (BudgetAddDialog (inline styles):1) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: reduce (BudgetAddDialog (inline styles):1)

How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.form-group) (c:\users\spani\onedrive\dokumente\github\noro-wedding\src\styles.scss:1) [prefersReducedMotion] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses animations and transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: redu... (C:\Users\spani\OneDrive\Dokumente\GitHub\noro-wedding\src\app\pages\account\login\login.scss:1)

testcase.name: Signin
testcase.system-out: Warnings (not failing): [colorContrast] Contrast 3.46:1 only meets AA for large text (18pt+). Normal-sized text requires higher contrast ratio How to fix: - Increase contrast to 4.5:1 for normal text - Acceptable for text 18pt+ or 14pt bold WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) Found: "&.validating": #e65100 on #fff3e0 [colorContrast] Low contrast 1.00:1 (needs 4.5:1). Low contrast text is difficult to read for users with low vision How to fix: - Increase contrast by darkening text or lightening background - Use contrast checker tool to verify WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) | See: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/ Found: "Privacy hint - LEGALLY REQUIRED - must always be v": rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6) on rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.02) [colorContrast] Highly transparent text is difficult to read. Low opacity reduces effective contrast How to fix: - Increase opacity to at least 0.55 - Use solid colors for text WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) Found: "rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.38)"

testcase.name: General
testcase.system-out: Warnings (not failing): [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon>check_circle</mat-icon> [colorContrast] Contrast 3.68:1 only meets AA for large text (18pt+). testcase.name: DosDonts
testcase.system-out: Warnings (not failing): [focusWithinSupport] Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.item)
